content.description:
Climb the south face. 

  Meh.  Every area needs a warm-up.   Would be better if the tree wasn't there.
content.location: The south face of Tall Boy boulder

content.description:
Start sitting.  Right hand on a two finger, half pad, quartz crimp(This is the left hand start hold for Pedoodle). Left hand on a similarly sized hold down low. 

  Left hand to a left leaning two-finger incut .  Then match on a longleft leaning edge(shared with Pedoodle), then go to the top.
content.location: Near the birch tree that's up against the boulder to the right of the Duzzi arete.

content.description: Start sitting near the birch tree that's up against the boulder to the right of the Duzzi arete.   Right hand in a sidepull flake, left hand on a two finger, half pad, quartz crimp.  Up to a long(room for two hands) left leaning edge, then go to the top.  Crux is fighting the swing out and avoiding the dab.
content.location: Near the birch tree that's up against the boulder to the right of the Duzzi arete.

content.description:
It's a Duzzi 

  Named after my good friend Lucas Peduzzi and because I broke a foothold and almost bought the farm. 

  It's a Duzzi starts on a large jug hold on the right end of the face and another large sloping jug out to the left. Climb up and out the arete and complete the hairy topout.
content.location: Far right end of the Tall Boy boulder (the large obvious one)

content.description: Freezer begins on the far right end of the Tall Boy boulder (the big obvious one). Start on two large jugs in the quartz part of the face (at head hight) Climb up and to the right following a dike with a couple of large holds. This leads to a airy topout at the highest point of the boulder.

This large hunk of schist is one of the first boulders to be developed in the area. This boulder provides the area with a handful of neat and unique boulder problems ranging in height and difficulty. This boulder has a stellar downclimb, and most of the top outs are supplied with an array of positive holds. All in all, this boulder is a great central location to warm-up and escape the common crowds found elsewhere in the park.
